result.execSummary:
The defendant Deontate Lerail Leatherberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent and follow through with any recommendations. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Deontate Lerail Leatherberry not in court.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter: Brady Bish.
Matter is set at 10:45 am for bond forf hearing but defense emailed this courts Clerk indicating neither deft nor atty would be appearing.

BTC: bond is forf'd and warrant is continued. If deft does appear at 10:45 am, the order will be vacated and the Court will go back on the record.
Warrant forwarded to RCSO for entry.

Defendant spoke to this Courts clerk and indicated he waited 10 minutes past his scheduled hearing time and then left the courtroom. He did not inquire if the court would be calling his case or even alert a court officer that he was there so they could altert the Court. His attorney was not available on the day of his hearing as he had a flat tire and could not be here. Defendant called on this date and indicated he has been trying to reach his attorney but has been unsuccessful. Clerk advised defendant that Atty Flanagan would have to schedule his walk in date to have the warrant quashed.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendants.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
